name: 蔡銘修
objective: Explore the principles, design, and practical applications of game-based digital learning. The content includes the advantages, characteristics, limitations, technology, media, design and development, systems, practical cases, and future trends of game-based digital learning.
schedule:
01 09/10 Course Description
02 09/17 Features and goals of digital game-based learning
03 09/24 Types of digital game-based learning: gamification vs Game based learning
04 10/01 Gamification: 8 Core Drives in Octalysis
05 10/08 Flow Theory 
06 10/15 Build simple game: Generally
07 10/22 Gamification: related research- Pagamo & classcraft
08 11/29 Group discussion
09 11/05 Midterm Week
10 11/12 The characteristics and objectives of digital game-based learning
11 11/19 Digital game-based learning: Hours of code & codecombat
12 11/26 Digital game-based learning: related research-Mini-flipped Game-based learning
13 12/03 Group discussion
14 12/10 The evaluation of digital game-based learning
15 12/17 VR & game based learning
16 12/24 Final Report I
17 12/31 Final Report II
18 01/07 Final exam week
scorePolicy:
Attendance 10%
Classroom Participation 20% 
Class Assignment 40%(Please Join google classroom "ldhvsd3" for week's assignments)
Final presentation and report 30%

One,
2~3 students in a group, choose one of the following projest
1. Game-based digital learning is useful for learning (paper from SSCI)
2. Game-based digital learning is not useful for learning (paper from SSCI)
3. Develop an educational digital game (real product)
4. Use game-based digital learning to assist classroom instruction (experimental or action research)
5. Observe the process of using game-based digital learning by students (or family members)
6. Use minecraft education version to build a world for players to learn on their own (hands-on production)
7. Other issues related to the course(need to be approved by instructor)
